title: Junior Data Scientist Digital
description:
.


Do you want to impact millions of users by improving digital data science products at the biggest omni-channel food retailer in the Netherlands and Belgium? Would you like to improve your technical and problem-solving skills working in a dedicated and enthusiastic team? Then we're looking for you!

  

As a Data Scientist working within our Digital Analytics and Data Science Team, you have the chance to contribute to important and high-impact features and value propositions of Albert Heijn. There are many exciting ongoing and upcoming projects in the digital domain of Albert Heijn. For example, helping customers find what they need and, thus, enhancing their shopping experience by working on the search project. Or helping our customers stay on top of best personalized discounted offers via the beloved Bonus Box project.

  



As a member of the team, you will also become part of the vibrant and large AH Data Science community. Your teammates have different backgrounds and nationalities, which we believe is an important asset. We work closely together with the rest of the organization in cross-functional teams covering all the necessary roles. This will enable you to work with engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders to deliver value for millions of customers every day.

  



You will also participate in the Data Talent track, a part-time one-and-a-half-year program full of soft and hard skills trainings. Additionally, you also have access to our AH Data Academy with many more trainings on both hard and soft skills. We consider it very important to give you a flying kickstart and the opportunity to continue developing yourself.

**As Junior Data Scientist, you:**
==================================

* Build data science solutions in the digital domain of Albert Heijn
* Solve problems holistically through analysis, modelling and AB testing
* Code, A/B test and put algorithms into production that serve in real-time our customers on web and app
* Have opportunities to strengthen our AB Test & Experimentation Platform, which is used widely in Albert Heijn.
* Convey complex ideas to different audiences in an effective manner
* Work in multidisciplinary product teams
* Share your knowledge with and learn from other team members


We’re looking for candidates with:

  

* A Master’s degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Econometrics, Computer Science, or other relevant studies. If no relevant study, demonstrably relevant experience and interest
* Knowledge of machine learning, natural language processing and large language model techniques
* Experience in Python and preferably also PySpark
* Experience using modern software development practices (IDEs, Unit testing, Source Control, CI/CD, etc.)
* Ability to communicate complex ideas to varied audiences
* Experience with cloud platforms, Databricks is a plus

**What we offer:**
==================

* A salary up to €4000 gross per period(4 weeks)year, excluding holiday allowance (8%) and a bonus
* 25,5 vacation days
* A budget choice in which you can decide whether you spend it on extra days off (+19,5 days), discounts or pay-outs
* Courses from our Albert Heijn Data Academy
* Flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home
* An excellent pension plan with a personal contribution of 6.2%
* A travel allowance for traveling to and from Zaandam
* Attractive discounts on various insurance policies
* A MacBook and an iPhone
* 10% discount on your grocery shopping in our Albert Heijn stores, up to €600per year

**Your Office:**
================


Albert Heijn, part of Ahold Delhaize, is the number one food retailer in the Netherlands. We’ve been inspiring customers and building trust for more than 130 years. We like to say, “we’re always there for you.” And with more than 1000 stores in the Netherlands and Belgium and 24/7 shopping on ah.nl, it’s truer than ever! But now we want to take our business to the next level. By making better food accessible to everyone – and making shopping fit the way people live today!

**Apply**
=========


Do you want to play an active role in changing the food retail landscape as we know it? Then hop on board and join us on our expedition. Apply via the button on this page. We ask you not to send a standard motivation letter, but to formulate an answer to the following questions:

* Why do you think you will be successful in this position and what kind of technical skills do you bring with you for this role?
* What is one of your personal strengths and one skill you wish to improve or develop?

  

Want to know more before you apply for our role at AH Technology? Peter Dirks, Talent Acquisition Partner Data Science & Analytics, is happy to tell you everything about this vacancy via peter.dirks@ah.nl


.

* ### **Solliciteren**


Stuur je sollicitatie in via deze website.

Als je aan het profiel voldoet nodigen we je snel uit voor een gesprek in de winkel.

Zijn we allebei enthousiast? Dan kun je snel beginnen! Welkom.

* Oplossingsgerichtheid
* Passie voor data
* Sterke tech skills
* Goede analytische skills
* Oog voor detail

title: Junior Financial Analist | AFS Interest
description:
*Als Junior Financial Analist speel je een cruciale rol in de ondersteuning van de handelsactiviteiten binnen AFS Interest. Wij hebben een uniek en wereldwijd klantenbestand variërend van banken, financiële instellingen, middelgrote en grote bedrijfsinstellingen en diverse supranationale & (quasi-) overheidsinstanties. Door middel van gegevensanalyse, marktonderzoek en strategische inzichten, ben jij een spin in het web om stakeholders correct te adviseren en te ondersteunen. In nauwe samenwerking met ons team van ervaren analisten, traders en industrie-experts krijg je een unieke kans om waardevolle praktijkervaring binnen de geld markt.*

  

#### **Wie zijn wij?**



AFS Group is een onafhankelijke intermediair binnen Financial Services en Renewable Energy. Bij AFS Group werken meer dan 160 FTE voor onze vier entiteiten (AFS Interest, Execution services, E-venues en AFS Energy). Met jouw kennis en ervaring weet jij ons team te structureren en verder te professionaliseren. Deze functie heeft betrekking op AFS Interest.  



  

Onze pijlers van succes:


* Samenwerkende expertise: Wij geloven in de kracht van samenwerking.
* Ethisch engagement: Onze onwrikbare inzet voor ethiek zorgt voor transparantie en vertrouwen in elke transactie.
* Ondernemersgeest: AFS Group belichaamt een ondernemende mentaliteit. We innoveren, passen ons aan en grijpen kansen.
* Ongeëvenaarde nauwkeurigheid: Precisie is ons kenmerk. Niet alleen naar onze klanten toe, maar ook intern.

#### **Focus van de functie**


* Adviseren, samenvatten, interpreteren en presenteren van nieuwsupdates, economische data, uitingen van centrale banken en andere complexe bronnen aan zowel collega’s als klanten op een duidelijke, effectieve en besluitvaardige manier.
* Vereenvoudigen van complexe beleidskwesties en andere materie die invloed hebben op de markt.
* Het verzamelen en analyzer van data, bouwen van spreadsheets en het genereren van content.
* Op de hoogte zijn van wet- en regelgeving die AFS Interest betreffen, en deze ook delen met de business (Fixed Income, Public Debt, Money Markets, Interest Rates Derivatives).
* Daarnaast zorg je ervoor dat je te allen tijde op de hoogte bent van trends, wetgeving, marktontwikkelingen en andere noodzakelijke informatie om je rol zo goed mogelijk te kunnen vervullen.
* In het bezit van een Masterdiploma in de richting van economie, economische geschiedenis, finance, business of policy.
* Vloeiende Nederlandse en Engelse taalvaardigheden. Italiaans is een plus!
* Zowel analytisch, als schrijfvaardig krachtig.
* Het vermogen hebben om grote hoeveelheden gegevens en informatie om te zetten in een praktisch en boeiend stuk.
* Interesse in de financiële markten.
* Enthousiast, proactief en leergierig van aard.
* Wij zoeken een kandidaat die niet bang is om in het diepe gegooid te worden en klaar is voor uitdagende taken.

  


#### **Wat wij bieden:**


* Een groep van enthousiaste, bruisende en internationale collega’s met meer dan 25 nationaliteiten
* Snelgroeiende en ambitieuze organisatie gevestigd op de oudste Stock Exchange floor van de wereld: Beursplein 5, Amsterdam
* 27 vakantiedagen per jaar (op fulltime basis)
* Mogelijkheid tot deelname gevarieerde lunch gemaakt door een in-house chef
* Indoor fitness, reiskostenvergoeding, korting op zorgverzekering, diverse teamactiviteiten en jaarlijkse AFS-feesten, activiteiten, vakanties en wekelijkse vrijdagmiddag borrels.

#### **Get in touch!**



Ben je klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging en word je graag onderdeel van onze snelgroeiende organisatie? Stuur dan jouw sollicitatie via het **sollicitatieformulier,** of neem contact op met Tanja Rammers.  



  

#### **Procedure:**



1e ronde: Videocall met onze Recruitment Lead



2e ronde: Face to face gesprek met de Senior Analyst



3e ronde: Head of AFS Interest / interne stakeholders.



Wanneer alle interviews positief zijn doorlopen, ontvang je van ons een job offer en kijken we uit naar een fijne samenwerking.

 *Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet gewaardeerd.*
company_description: At AFS, we believe our greatest asset is our people. It is only with the dedication and determination of our people that we can provide the best possible service to our clients.

title: Senior Market Intelligence Analyst (Customer Facing)
description:
In this role, you will be central to producing high-quality insights and foresights to our customers to support strategy execution and development. The insights are delivered to our customers through our Market Intelligence platform and in quarterly and yearly sessions in which you will have a big role.


Do you enjoy and enjoy translating data into actionable insights and foresights, and are you an experienced Project Manager?


Read on!


‍

##### **What You'll Be Doing:**


As a Customer-Facing Senior Market Intelligence Analyst, you will be responsible end-to-end for the delivery to our clients. This includes market analysis, project management, and most importantly, hosting sessions with customers. In these sessions, you will guide customers in interpreting data points, discussing use cases, and demonstrating the value of our SaaS dashboard and tailored market intelligence solutions. Additionally, you will:

* Host informative and interactive sessions with customers to ensure they continuously see the value in our products.
* Utilize various sources such as annual reports and trade databases to uncover key trends that inform strategic decisions.
* Collaborate with customers and the Market Intelligence Analyst team to structure and execute workstreams effectively.
* Continuously enhance our insight generation processes to maintain the highest level of data accuracy.
* Use your expertise to predict trends and integrate foresights into client strategies.
* Develop intuitive models and visualizations to support data-driven decisions for our team and clients.


‍

###### **Projects You’ll Work On:**

* Market Assessments: Evaluate market potential for key segments within large agricultural and food companies using public and proprietary data to support strategic planning and investment decisions.
* Competitive Benchmarking: Conduct in-depth competitive reviews for major food customers, synthesizing data into strategic recommendations for senior management.


‍

###### **What Success Looks Like:**

* First 30 Days: Familiarize yourself with our company culture, data systems, and client profiles to integrate effectively into our team.
* First 90 Days: Enhance your skills to actively engage in and contribute to quarterly customer discussions, aligning your efforts with our strategic goals.
* First 180 Days: Lead project workstreams in market and competitor analysis and prepare content for customer workshops, showcasing your growing independence and expertise.


‍

###### **Challenges:**

* Efficiently process and refine extensive datasets to maintain data integrity and ensure actionable insights.
* Quickly adapt to the complexities of our operational and analytical tools, becoming proficient in their use.


‍

###### **Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):**

* Measure the effectiveness of insights through customer feedback and their impact on client decision-making processes.


‍

##### **Your Talent:**

* Independent thinker with a strong analytical mindset, eager to take on challenges and drive results.
* Strong communication skills, capable of explaining complex data in understandable terms.
* Proficient in Excel, with experience in visualization and data analytics tools (e.g., Python, Power BI, SQL) being a plus.
* Demonstrable experience managing complex projects and stakeholders efficiently.
* Proven ability to handle complex datasets and generate meaningful business insights.
* 2 to 5 years of experience and a degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or similar fields.
* Strong commercial grasp and experience in a customer-facing role are essential.


‍

##### **Who you'll be working with:**


Miriam
Head of Insights & Strategic Services
Jurre
Junior Analyst
Tolga
Market Intelligence Analyst##### **What We Offer:**

* Competitive salary range of €47,000 - €60,000 annually, including an 8% holiday bonus.
* Performance bonus of up to 10% of your gross salary.
* Hybrid work setup with 2-5 days in the office per week.
* Regular company events like dinners, BBQs, boat trips, and padel tournaments, fostering a vibrant team culture.


‍

###### **Application Process:**

* Screening Call: Start your application with a call from our recruiter to discuss your background and fit for the role.
* Online Skill-Based Assessment
* In-Person Interview: If successful in the initial stages, you'll be invited to our Amsterdam office for an in-depth interview to further assess your fit with our team and culture.


‍


‍


‍


‍

##### **A-INSIGHTS**


A-INSIGHTS is the fastest growing company and market intelligence platform in the market. Trusted and loved by some of the world's largest companies (Bayer, McCain, Ahold, RoyalFrieslandCampina, Gemeente Amsterdam), we combine worldwide publicly available company and market data with the latest domain & tech expertise.


Our goal is to set the international standard for objective company performance insights based on publicly available data.


And our journey is just getting started!


Every day, we make it easy for organizations around the world to make a difference through best-in-class insights and unmatched service. And we don’t plan on stopping anytime soon.


We are building a team of passionate and talented people who are eager to contribute to this growth and help us write our story.


‍

##### **Ready to Apply?**


If this role excites you, apply today via our careers page! Research indicates that some groups, particularly women, are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you're passionate about joining us but don't meet all the criteria, we still encourage you to apply. We're excited to see how your unique skills might contribute to our team at A-INSIGHTS.


‍

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**About ZDHC**



The ZDHC Foundation develops and implements the Roadmap to Zero Programme with a focus on reducing the chemical footprint of the Fashion Industry. We are the leading sustainability organisation driving sustainable chemistry, innovations and best practices in textile, apparel, leather and footwear manufacturing to protect consumers, workers and the environment. Through collaborative engagement, alignment and large-scale implementation, we take a holistic approach to sustainable chemical management and enable tangible progress in the wider industry through the delivery of guidelines, platforms and solutions including capacity building and innovation projects.



For more information about ZDHC see www.roadmaptozero.com. Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.

 **Vision & Mission**



The ZDHC Vision is a World in which better chemistry leads to the protection of life, land, air and water.



The ZDHC Mission is to lead our global value chain to achieve the highest standard for sustainable chemical management, driving resource efficiency and circularity.

 **Job Purpose**



ZDHC is seeking a highly motivated professional to join the ZDHC Roadmap to Zero Implementation Team as a Financial Analyst. The successful candidate will contribute to the global roll-out, implementation and evolution of key projects and programmes with a focus across the value chain on the implementation of ZDHC guidelines and solutions, with the goal of supporting stakeholder success in creating positive impact in line with ZDHC’s mission and values.

### **Key Responsibilities:**


* Accounts Payable (AP) and Accounts Receivable (AR): Manage AP/AR processes ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
* GL Reconciliation: Reconcile credit card statements with bank statements monthly.
* Collections: Monitor and manage collections to maintain healthy cash flow.
* Financial Reporting: Prepare and analyze financial statements, ensuring compliance with accounting standards.
* Bank Reconciliations: Perform monthly bank reconciliations to ensure financial accuracy.

  

**Skills:**


* Microsoft Excel: Advanced proficiency, including pivot tables, XLOOKUP, and data analysis tools.
* Financial Software: Experience with financial management software.
* Communication: Strong English skills; Dutch is a plus.
* Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy in financial data management.


**ZDHC Specific Attributes**


* Team player with an international background – able to work well and create strong positive relationships with individuals from a range of different cultural backgrounds.
* Able to manage multiple work activities and deliver results in a timely and efficient manner.
* Goal orientated, results driven whilst also being a confident communicator.
* Self-driven and motivated.
* Confidently operate in a fast paced frequently changing environment.
* Able to proactively initiate and take responsibility for results and work activities that may not specifically identified in this job description.
* Flexible with a high tolerance for ambiguity.
* Practical and pragmatic - exhibit a ‘can do’ attitude that is solution orientated.
* Strong analytical ability to interpret information and translate into solutions and/or improvements.
* Able to establish strong positive relationships with relevant stakeholders.



If you meet the qualifications and are excited about the opportunity to make a difference in the sustainable textile and footwear industry, we encourage you to apply for this position.

 **IMPORTANT NOTE**  

***Location:*** Our preference is for a candidate living and working in the Netherlands. Candidates from other countries will only be considered if they have the rights to live and work in the EU.


**Please note:** If you are a candidate with the current right to live and work in the EU and anticipate needing sponsorship in the near future, please note that ZDHC is not in a position to sponsor candidates. If this applies to you, please specify your current work permit situation in your cover letter. Additionally, please be aware that this hiring process is not supported by a relocation package to move to the Netherlands.

title: Business Analist - Procurement and Sourcing
description:
Are you excited to be part of our dynamic team where business meets technology? Driving Rituals' growth through innovative tools within our Business Technology department.


**Share your talents**
----------------------


Rituals is a globally recognized brand offering a luxurious range of home and body cosmetics. Committed to enhancing everyday routines into meaningful rituals, we strive to create an enriching experience for our customers. We are seeking a talented and motivated Tech Business Analyst for the Procure to pay systems and process (P2P) to join our Business Technology team.


The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing technology systems, processes, and data to drive improvements and optimizations that contribute to the overall success of the company. Working closely with product owners, project managers, and external partners responsible for our applications to ensure alignment between business goals and technological solutions. Collaborate effectively with these stakeholders to gather insights, retrieve requirements and analyzing the impact on the end-to-end process and critically measure them with our BT vision. Contribute to the successful delivery of Tech continuous improvements and projects. Act as a liaison between business teams and technology teams, facilitating effective communication and understanding of objectives.




Apart from this your responsibilities will include:

* Technology Analysis: Conduct comprehensive analysis of existing systems, processes related to the Purchase to pay (P2P) process and data to identify areas for improvement and optimization.
* Requirement Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather business requirements, analyze user needs, and translate them into functional specifications for Tech solutions.
* Solution Development: Work closely with cross-functional teams including business and software partners to design, develop, and implement Tech solutions that meet business objectives.
* Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure that Tech solutions adhere to regulatory compliance standards and mitigate any potential risks associated with financial systems.
* Continuous Improvement: Proactively identify opportunities for process enhancements, system integrations, and technological advancements to streamline financial operations and enhance efficiency.
* Documentation, monitoring, support: Responsible for accurate (process) documentation, facilitate smooth adoption and understanding of new Tech solutions by end-users and support teams, making sure monitoring and support is in place when delivering improvements.

**Bring all of you**
--------------------


High on energy, low on ego and with a of little bit humour. You are naturally curious, analytical, and adept at applying rapidly changing technology to address business needs. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and are committed to driving excellence. Moreover, you have:

* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or related field. Master’s degree or relevant certifications is a plus.
* Proven experience (3 years) working as a Business Analyst in the Tech sector or in the financial field.
* Strong understanding of end-to-end process improvements. In the retail / consumer goods sector is a plus.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
* Analytical mindset with a keen eye for detail, problem-solving skills, and a strategic approach to drive continuous improvement.
* Thrives in an open, fast-paced environment, embraces change, and excels in a dynamic and flexible setting
* Agile mindset with a passion for innovation and continuous improvement.
* Experience with systems like JIRA and Confluence, Procurements systems (like Coupa) and integrations with ERP are a plus.
* Experience in the procurement field is a plus.




Interested?  

  

Grow with us and please apply via the website! The next steps are:

* Our recruiter will contact you within 10 working days
* An introductory meeting with a team member and the hiring manager follows
* A second interview where you present a business case
* In the event of a positive outcome, you will receive a proposal with the terms of employment


Any questions? Let Lars know via lars.jongkind@rituals.com

**Benefits of working at Rituals**
----------------------------------

* Training, coaching & development opportunities
* Staff discount on Rituals products
* Attractive bonus
* Numerous health & wellbeing initiatives
* Company & team events

title: Market Research Analyst
description:
**We believe that great healthcare is an essential safeguard of human dignity.**
At Laborie, we know the work we do matters – it’s what fuels our motivation and contributes to our success. If you’re ready to make a positive impact in the lives of patients across the globe, we’d like to meet you.
We support and empower our employees to grow their careers in an environment that encourages a sense of belonging and a connection to doing good. We’re not afraid to roll up our sleeves to make our goals a reality and work together to solve for our customers. We reward and recognize our employees based on our values of **Aspire to Greatness, Respect All, Own It, Working Together, Persist with Passion.****Who We’re Looking For:**
As a key member of the **Global Marketing** team, the **Market Research Analyst's** principal responsibilities are to collect, analyze and present relevant data to help Laborie improve commercial initiatives. This is a full-time (40 hours per week) role. The Market Research Analyst will report to the Senior Market Research Analyst.**About the Role:*** Conduct in-depth market research and generate actionable insights into regular reports for commercial teams to optimize marketing and sales strategies.
* Collect data for all product lines to estimate opportunities and market share.
* Review global government healthcare policies, reports, clinical literature to spot and summarize healthcare trends.
* Aggregate large healthcare databases, create and maintain customizable Power BI reports for internal stakeholders.
* Provide competitive analysis and present findings on various companies’ market offerings, market positions, pricing/business models and commercial strategies.

**Minimum Qualifications:*** 4-year college degree (B.S./B.A.) in Market Research, Marketing, Business Administration, Life Science or related field required.
* Proven market research analysis experience.
* Competence with Microsoft Office 365 applications including Power BI, Tableau, Excel, SQL, and other search engines, web analytics, and business research tools.
* Adequate knowledge of data collection methods and tools (polls, focus groups, surveys, Qualtrics etc.) with working knowledge of data warehousing, modelling and mining.
* English language proficiency (written and verbal) required.
* Knowledge of the healthcare industry preferred.


**Why Laborie:**
Our Mission every day is to operate as a world-class specialist medical company making and advancing technologies that preserve and restore human dignity. We do that today by helping people with pelvic and gastrointestinal conditions live normal lives, and by helping mothers and babies have safe deliveries.* Competitive salary
* Paid time off and paid volunteer time
* Health insurance group discounts
* Company car where applicable
* Pension plan
* Flexible working model in an international team

*Laborie* *provides equal employment opportunities and non-discrimination for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to a person’s race, color, gender, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. Laborie is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodation in our services, activities, education, and employment for individuals with disabilities.*
company_description: LABORIE is an industry-leading innovator and manufacturer of medical technologies serving customers across the globe. We enjoy a strong diversity of talent and our business is growing.

title: Client Account Analyst
description:
Applicants must live in a commutable distance from Breda, NL.

The Client Account Analyst is accountable for supporting the daily activities related to the processing of assigned client accounts. The individual is responsible for responding to internal and external requests to identify process improvements and facilitate solutions.

**PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:**

* Independently manages and responds to routine questions, processing issues and requests according to company-defined procedures.
* Thoroughly analyzes processed data, issues and requests and clearly communicates them verbally and in writing using company-approved methods and tools.
* Analyzes freight rates received from clients and presents clear and complete freight rate information to rating team in a timely manner.
* Verifies freight invoices for assigned accounts by using the CassPort Exception Management system and ensuring the amount charged by the carrier agrees with the rates on file from the customer.
* Identifies changes and other enhancements which will improve the overall efficiency and quality of processing.
* Acts as a positive representative of the company, both internally and externally, in accordance with written principles of the organization without direction or oversight from management.
* Keeps key stakeholders, including the account manager and/or management, informed of significant issues on a timely basis.
* Seeks guidance from the appropriate account manager or management on significant non-routine issues.
* Possesses a thorough understanding and ability to explain and promote our web-based services.
* Other duties as assigned.

**SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:**

* Well-developed organizational skills in order to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Proficient in the Microsoft Office suite with an intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Excel (ability to create pivot tables and utilize VLOOKUP).
* A strong ability to communicate effectively, both written and verbal, at all levels
* Ability to fluently communicate (in writing and speech) in both English and Dutch.
* Strong analytical skills to conduct root cause analysis.

**MINIMUM LEVEL OF PREPARATION AND TRAINING NORMALLY REQUIRED:**

* A bachelor's degree in logistics or business administration or a related field or equivalent experience.
* 1 – 2 years of experience in a logistics or financial services environment preferred.
* 1 – 2 years of customer relations experience in a technical services environment.

Aanvragers moeten op woon-werkafstand van Breda, NL wonen.

De Client Account Analyst is verantwoordelijk voor het ondersteunen van de dagelijkse activiteiten met betrekking tot de verwerking van toegewezen klantaccounts. Het individu is verantwoordelijk voor het reageren op interne en externe verzoeken om procesverbeteringen te identificeren en oplossingen te faciliteren.

**BELANGRIJKSTE VERANTWOORDELIJKHEDEN EN PLICHTEN:**

* Beheert en reageert zelfstandig op routinevragen en verwerkt problemen en verzoeken volgens door het bedrijf gedefinieerde procedures.
* Analyseert verwerkte gegevens, problemen en verzoeken grondig en communiceert deze duidelijk mondeling en schriftelijk met behulp van door het bedrijf goedgekeurde methoden en hulpmiddelen.
* Analyseert vrachttarieven ontvangen van klanten en presenteert tijdig duidelijke en volledige informatie over vrachttarieven aan het beoordelingsteam.
* Verifieert vrachtfacturen voor toegewezen accounts met behulp van het CassPort Exception Management-systeem en zorgt ervoor dat het door de vervoerder in rekening gebrachte bedrag overeenkomt met de tarieven die door de klant zijn geregistreerd.
* Identificeert veranderingen en andere verbeteringen die de algehele efficiëntie en kwaliteit van de verwerking zullen verbeteren.
* Treedt op als een positieve vertegenwoordiger van het bedrijf, zowel intern als extern, in overeenstemming met de schriftelijke principes van de organisatie, zonder leiding of toezicht van het management.
* Houdt de belangrijkste belanghebbenden, waaronder de accountmanager en/of het management, tijdig op de hoogte van belangrijke kwesties.
* Vraagt advies aan de juiste accountmanager of het management bij belangrijke niet-routinematige problemen.
* Beschikt over een grondig begrip en vermogen om onze webgebaseerde diensten uit te leggen en te promoten.
* Andere taken zoals toegewezen.

**VEREISTE VAARDIGHEDEN EN VAARDIGHEDEN:**

* Goed ontwikkelde organisatorische vaardigheden om meerdere taken tegelijkertijd uit te voeren.
* Vaardig in het Microsoft Office-pakket met een gemiddelde kennis van Microsoft Excel (mogelijkheid om draaitabellen te maken en VERT.ZOEKEN te gebruiken).
* Een sterk vermogen om effectief te communiceren, zowel schriftelijk als mondeling, op alle niveaus
* Vermogen om vloeiend te communiceren (schriftelijk en mondeling) in zowel het Engels als het Nederlands.
* Sterke analytische vaardigheden om root-cause analyses uit te voeren.

**MINIMUMNIVEAU VAN VOORBEREIDING EN TRAINING NORMAAL VEREIST:**

* Een bachelordiploma in logistiek of bedrijfskunde of een gerelateerd vakgebied of gelijkwaardige ervaring.
* Bij voorkeur 1-2 jaar ervaring in een logistieke of financiële dienstverleningsomgeving.
* 1 – 2 jaar ervaring met klantrelaties in een technische dienstverleningsomgeving.

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 4837 DS Breda

title: Data - Analist
description:
*Heb jij met je kennis op het gebied van ICT altijd al willen werken in een zorgomgeving waarin jouw kennis van ongelofelijke toegevoegde waarde is? Weet jij data om te zetten naar waardevolle informatie voor onze interne klanten? Kun je deze informatie ook in duidelijke taal uitleggen? Dan is dit DE vacature voor jou?*


#### **Werkplek**

Als Data- Analist maak je onderdeel uit van het team Data Analytics. Dit team bestaat uit een data architect, een BI-specialist en een applicatiebeheerder. Wij vinden het belangrijk dat er gezamenlijk gewerkt wordt aan datavraagstukken en er over en weer goede afstemming plaatsvindt over de voortgang en verwachte opleveringen. Afstemming met collega’s over de wijze waarop je ontwikkelingen doorvoert is hierin belangrijk om zo samen tot de beste oplossingen te komen.



We werken hybride, dat betekent dat we gedeeltelijk op kantoor en gedeeltelijk thuis werken. Ons kantoor staat in Eindhoven.


#### **Functie**

In deze rol krijg je de mogelijkheid je te bekwamen als Data Analist en een belangrijke bijdrage te geven aan het vormen van een Data Competence Center. Verantwoordelijkheden en taken die je bij deze functie horen zijn de volgende:


* Nadruk op het weergeven van data via reporting en visualisatie
* Zorgdragen voor het verzamelen van data en het beheer erop
* Definities van data vaststellen


**De werktijden**  

Het dienstverband wordt in overleg met jou afgestemd, we bieden daarin veel mogelijkheden.


#### **Wij bieden jou**


* Een contract voor gemiddeld 32 tot 36 uur per week
* Salaris conform CAO Gehandicaptenzorg FWG 55. De inschaling is afhankelijk van je relevante werkervaring
* Vakantiegeld (8%), een eindejaarsuitkering (8,33%)
* 1-daags introductieprogramma
* Een ruim aanbod aan doelgroepgerichte scholing
* Toegang tot meer dan 100 online-trainingen
* Pluspakket met keuzeregelingen, zoals fietsplan en korting op fitness

#### **Wij vragen**

**Wij vragen**


* Minimaal HBO werk- en denkniveau
* 0 - 2 jaar relevante werkervaring (ervaring met modelleren van datamodellen voor het datawarehouse)
* Bekend met Data Warehousing
* Ervaring met reporting en het visualiseren van data
* SQL/ database kennis/ Power BI
* Kennis van spreadsheets
* Communicatief vaardig, pro-actief en creatief


Wij vragen van al onze nieuwe medewerkers om een “Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag” te overhandigen voor hun functie binnen Lunet zorg.


#### **Over de organisatie**

Lees hier meer over wie wij zijn en wat wij doen
#### **Solliciteer**

Je kunt bij ons solliciteren door je cv te uploaden. Binnen drie werkdagen nemen wij contact met je op. Je kunt solliciteren.



Voor inhoudelijke vragen neem contact op met Nancy Wiggers de Vries (Teamleider) via: 088-5515440

title: Data Analyst
description:
#### **Opportunity**


ILIAS Solutions is on the hunt for an experienced Data Analyst, adept at leveraging ERP and sensor data from sophisticated military assets to bolster decision-making and operational efficiency across our defense clientele.  

  

With a focus on delivering standardized analytical solutions, this role calls for an individual capable of swiftly grasping new subjects, informed by a broad dataset encompassing various defense assets and their supporting operations. Your analytical skills will illuminate strategic insights for assets like Fighter Aircraft, Military Transport Aircraft, Frigates, and Submarines, offering our clients a competitive edge in defense capabilities.  

  

You can work in the Almere or Brussels office and at home, with occasional travel to global customer sites.  

  

Want to learn more about your mission? Scroll down for more information.

#### **Your mission**


As our data analyst you will:

  

* Analyze a wide array of data sources, including ERP and sensor data from diverse military assets such as Fighter Aircraft, Military Transport Aircraft, Frigates, and Submarines, to provide uniform and powerful analytical solutions.
* Ensure our data analysis services securely and effectively meet the common strategic objectives of our defense clients, applying a consistent approach across similar customer profiles.
* Serve as the key communicator between technical teams and clients, adeptly translating complex data findings into actionable strategies.
* Keep abreast of the latest developments in data analysis, enhancing our ability to provide cutting-edge analytical services.

#### **Your capabilities**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Aviation, or a related field.
* At least 3 years of experience in data analysis, with a proven ability to quickly adapt and understand new subjects based on a broad set of data.
* Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, and statistical analysis, demonstrated through the application of these skills to diverse data sets.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, capable of simplifying complex technical details for a non-technical audience.
* Willingness to occasionally travel to engage directly with our international clients.

#### **Land @ILIAS**


Let Youness know what your talents are and send your CV to youness.kaissi@ilias-solutions.com

#### **About us**


ILIAS Solutions is a company on a mission. With 150 passionate colleagues across Belgium, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the US, we design and deliver software solutions that make a real difference for our customers in Defense and other industries. As we continue to grow, we are looking for talented reinforcement who will make a difference every day.

title: Asset Management Operations, Data Governance, Analyst, The Hague
description:
Asset Management Operations, Data Governance, Analyst, The Hague
AWM delivers innovative investment solutions through a global, multi- product platform that offers clients the advantages that come with working with a large firm, while maintaining the benefits of a boutique. AWM is one of the pre-eminent investment management organizations globally. Critical to the success of AWM is our ability to leverage a global team of talented professionals to define solutions and lead change across the operational infrastructure.
  

  

The AM Operations Global Data Governance team is seeking to add a highly motivated professional to its organization. This team is primarily focused on building & maintaining a scalable Data Governance framework for data attributes published in internal and external reports. The Data Governance team works closely with Operations, Business, Legal, Compliance, Controllers, Technology, and other groups in establishing data pipelines and maintaining data value chains connected to various reporting outputs of the organization.
  

  

With your expertise, our data owners, stewards, and subject matter experts can ensure the integrity of our data throughout its lifecycle. Your contribution will lead to trusted data for our clients, our investment processes, and operations.
  

  

Responsibilities
  

* Leverage analytical skills, creative problem solving and project management skills to steer and uplift the existing Data Governance model.
* Organize discussions with key stakeholders to understand how our technology works, thereby empowering you to define specific data attributes, identify the relevant owners, and source system(s) along with Data flows.
* Improve the risk framework for data governance by documenting existing controls, analyzing their suitability, and recommending new controls for implementation.
* Develop strong working relationships with Sales, Legal, Compliance, Controllers, Technology, and other groups in establishing the Data Governance model and keeping it up to date.
* Work with Business Intelligence & Low code Automation solutions to digitize the Data Governance framework and improve efficiency.

Regularly assess and refine data governance processes and policies in line with the industry best practice to promote continuous improvement.  
* 

Qualifications
  

* Bachelor's/ Master's Degree (Engineering, Finance, Economics, Business Management)
* Understanding of data governance concepts, principles, and best practices
* Strong analytical and organizational skills
* Excellent communication, both in listening and conveying messages to a wide range of stakeholder groups
* Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy
* Ability to handle multiple projects, deadlines, personalities, and broad based coverage
* Knowledge and understanding of Excel, PowerPoint, Word and adaptability to other software products
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment
* Knowledge of the investment management industry and GSAM is a bonus

A basic idea of Business Intelligence and data visualisation tools is a bonus  
* 

  

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
  

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.
  

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.
  

We're committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html
  

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2023. All rights reserved.
  

Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Digital Analyst WE - Converse
description:
Become part of the Converse Team  

  

Converse is a place to explore potential, break barriers and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Converse, it's about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving world to make things better as a team.  

  

Converse is the story of a sneaker that started on the court and moved to the stage and street. We're a company ready for change and that's who we hire: the most malleable, the most innovative, and the most creative. Our clothes and sneakers have been worn by rebels, rockers, rappers, artists, thinkers, and individuals. So that's why we hire individuals. So we're speaking the same language.  

  

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR  

  

We're growing and you can grow with us. Through our digital acceleration strategy we lead with Digital and move at the pace of the consumer. We're looking for a creative, resourceful and data-driven individual who has a passion for analyzing consumer shopping behaviors on our e-commerce sites. In this role you will be responsible for creating reports and delivering actionable insights which shape decision making to drive growth for our digital business. You will collaborate with geography and global partners to enhance our site and business reporting capabilities in order for us to gain deeper insights into our consumers.  

  

WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
  

* Use Adobe Analytics and Tableau to analyse and visualise on clickstream data and segment site visitors to discover trends in visitor behavior.
* Identify traffic and conversion trends by channel, abandonment issues and opportunities for improving site conversion
* Create consistent tracking, analysis and reporting of core KPIs in daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly dashboard formats that drive effective business decision-making.
* Conduct quantitative analysis to provide actionable insights to drive improvements in overall consumer experience, online sales and margins.
* Work closely with the Digital Experience & Merchandising team on managing online checkout performance, conversion, tests, and sales; Plan and execute consumer feedback via A/B testing, and site analytics to improve upon existing or proposed functionalities.
* Manage, maintain and take ownership over page tagging and validating the quality of data that is captured within Adobe Analytics; Provide site tagging requirements for (new) site content and functionality
* Conduct analysis projects for Performance Marketing, Site Merchandising and Buying/Planning teams to provide insights into user behavior and to drive higher sell-thru on key items
* Staying on top of current industry trends and best practices in web analysis

  

WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH  

  

Given the cross-functionality of the role, it is critical to build strong relationships and partner with Digital Merchandising, Marketing, Buying, Planning and Operations in order to create reports that provide consumer insights needed to improve the consumer experience and help drive sales for the ecommerce business. The digital analyst will be active in the global consumer direct sciences' community sharing their knowledge and best-practices in reporting capabilities and delivering insights. This role reports into the Senior Manager of Consumer Direct Sciences for Western Europe Digital Direct.  

  

WHAT YOU BRING
  

* Proven previous experience in web analytics or online business intelligence is required, with prior digital retail experience as preferred
* Solid understanding of DTC business and ability to drive value in that space would be crucial
* Passion to drive business decisions with data and analyses
* Excellent quantitative skills and the proven ability to analyze, synthesize and distill large volumes of data down to key takeaways
* Excellent working knowledge and experience with Adobe Analytics, Tableau and Business Intelligence (BI) is required
* Strong understanding of web technologies, experience with SFCC a plus.
* Deep knowledge of digital data & analytics, including tracking methodologies, website page tagging, attribution models, dashboards and correlation analyses; experience with tagging tools a plus
* Proven experience in designing, executing and analyzing A/B and multivariate testing
* Proven ability to present actionable insights from analytics findings and to make clear recommendations to senior management
* Excellent communication, collaboration and influencing skills with a problem-solving mentality and drive for results
* Ability to work across cultures and geographies to support local digital needs
* Self starter mentality and enjoys working in a fast paced environment

  

Applications for this role will be accepted until end of day 7 August 2024.  

  

Converse is more than a company; it's a worldwide advocate for self-expression. This belief motivates our employees, permeates our working environment and inspires our products. No two of us look or think exactly alike. We are each one-of-a-kind. Individually and as a culture, we have the freedom to create and grow professionally. Generous benefits packages only sweeten the experience. From Boston to Shanghai, from Brand Design to Finance, Converse is a brand that celebrates the unique and creative people of the world. Together, we're different.  

  

**Benefits**  

  

Whether it's transportation or financial health, we continually invest in our employees to help them achieve greatness - inside and outside of work. All who work here should be able to realize their full potential.

title: Data analist bij de Zorgadministratie
description:
**Data analist bij de Zorgadministratie**
=========================================


Bij de meest toonaangevende Zorgadministratie werk je in een dynamische omgeving waar innovatie en samenwerking centraal staan. Ben jij klaar om een verschil te maken in de toekomst van de afdeling?


Reageer t/m 26-08-2024
31.07.24.SB3
  
### **Functie inhoud**


Als data analist adviseer en ondersteun je de (DBC) adviseurs van de Zorgadministratie. Je bent onderdeel van de PDCA cyclus en vervult hierin een adviserende en monitorende rol.  

  

Jouw bijdrage is:


* Zorgdragen dat het DNA van de zorgadministratie steeds meer datagedreven is. Dit doe je onder andere door gebruik van process mining en dashboarding.
* Identificeren en kwantificeren van risico's in verschillende registratieprocessen.
* Vanuit de data gevraagd en ongevraagd advies geven met betrekking tot juistheid, volledigheid en tijdigheid in het registratieproces.
* Het opstellen van kwalitatieve rapportages, waarmee DBC adviseurs het huis in kunnen.

  
### **Werkomgeving**


De Zorgadministratie van het Erasmus MC is de meest toonaangevende Zorgadministratie van Nederland! Gedreven door innovatie en technologie, verbeteren en vernieuwen wij onze ketenprocessen van registratie, facturatie, inning en verantwoording voortdurend. Onze ambitie is om de verantwoordingsketen te transformeren door geavanceerde technologieën in te zetten. Hierdoor beheersen we risico's optimaal en zijn we aantoonbaar in control voor onszelf én onze partners. Op die manier dragen we bij aan het financieel gezond houden van het Erasmus MC en kunnen we hoogwaardige zorg blijven leveren aan onze patiënten.   

Je werkt in een complexe en dynamische omgeving. Naast jou zijn er nog 3 andere enthousiaste en bevlogen data analisten binnen de Zorgadministratie. Samen dragen jullie bij aan het behalen van de doelen van de Zorgadministratie.


  
### **Profiel**


Ben jij een energieke en gedreven data analist die helemaal op kan gaan in het analyseren van data en processen?  

  

Stel je dan voor: je stapt binnen in een dynamische omgeving, waar ambitie en innovatie de drijvende krachten zijn. Als data analist geef jij met je analyses richting aan ons succes. Jouw vaardigheden zijn van onschatbare waarde en je weet met jouw scherpe inzichten en creatieve denkwijze de organisatie te sturen in de juiste richting. Met een vurige passie voor data en innovatie en een ongekende drive om het verschil te maken, ben je constant op zoek naar nieuwe manieren om processen te verbeteren en efficiëntie te verhogen. Je staat niet stil bij het behalen van resultaten; je streeft ernaar om steeds verder te gaan, om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan en nieuwe doelen te bereiken. Je bent een pionier, altijd op zoek naar nieuwe mogelijkheden en nieuwe kansen om te groeien en te innoveren.  

  

  

Beschik jij over:


* Minimaal een afgeronde hbo/wo opleiding, bij voorkeur op het gebied van beleid & management gezondheidszorg (BMG), (bedrijfs)economie of vergelijkbaar vakgebied.
* Uitstekende analytische vaardigheden in onder andere Excel en PowerBI.
* Minimaal twee jaar relevante werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functie.
* En ben je nieuwsgierig, proactief en een teamplayer?


   

Dan ben jij klaar om deze uitdaging aan te gaan en samen met ons de toekomst van de Zorgadministratie vorm te geven! Solliciteer dan nu en ontdek hoe jij het verschil kunt maken bij het Erasmus MC!

  

 

Bekijk hier de voorwaarden voor indiensttreding bij Erasmus MC.


  
### **Wat bieden wij**

  

* Een jaarcontract met uitzicht op een vast dienstverband.
* Een bruto maandsalaris tussen de € 4.678,- en € 6.402,- (schaal 11) bij een volledige werkweek van 36 uur.
* Deels thuiswerken en 4 x 9 uur werken is mogelijk.
* Doorgroeimogelijkheden en opleidingen.
* Een 13e maand die we in november uitkeren en een persoonlijk reiskostenbudget.
* Een pensioenverzekering bij het ABP. Wij betalen 70% van je pensioenpremie waardoor het netto salaris hoger uitvalt dan je misschien denkt.
* Sportfaciliteiten in het Erasmus MC. En heb je een lekke band? Onze fietsenmaker repareert deze graag.

  

 

Alle arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn conform de cao Universitair Medische Centra.


  
### **Meer informatie**


Maak van deze vacature jouw nieuwe baan! Solliciteren is zo gedaan via de sollicitatiebutton.  

  

Inhoudelijke vragen over de vacature? Tahra Medani, Senior adviseur Zorgadministratie, beantwoordt deze met plezier via 06 252 081 15.

  

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze advertentie is niet gewenst.
company_description: Meewerken aan de zorg van de toekomst. Het begint met doen.

title: Marketing Data Analist
description:
Dit wordt je baan

  

Jij weet als geen ander wat het werken met data in een marketing omgeving inhoudt. Zo analyseer jij data, biedt jij inzicht in deze data en geef je advies over het verbeteren en automatiseren van (marketing)campagnes. Wat het werk van een marketing data analist extra bijzonder maakt bij VvAA is uiteraard de het doel waar waar wij voor werken: zorgprofessionals en zorgorganisaties in Nederland ontzorgen. . Hoewel je thuisbasis de data afdeling is, werk je veel samen in een (vast) multidisciplinair agile-team. Dit team bestaat uit diverse functies namelijk; een product owner, (online) marketeerverenigingsadviseur en twee webredacteuren. Het team is gericht op alle individuele leden/klanten van VvAA.) Binnen het team richt de data analist zich bijvoorbeeld op klantcontact, waarbij de jij als data analist het proces meet als er een mail naar de klant uitgaat: hoe vaak word de mail geopend, hoe vaak wordt er op de link geklikt, etc.. Vervolgens kan je advies geven aan de hand van de verkregen data voor eventuele toekomstige verbeteringen.  

Alle agile-teams werken aan één doel in sprints van twee weken en juist de grensoverschrijdende samenwerking maakt het werk uitdagender. Zo krijg jij als data analist je eigen focusgebied waarin je aan diverse datavraagstukken werkt.  

  

**Dit krijg je van ons**  

Een baan als data analist waarin je de vrijheid krijgt om te doen waar je goed in bent, en hier nog beter in te worden. Zo krijg jij bij ons de ruimte om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen. Hier sta je aan het roer van je eigen groeiplan. Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij met plezier werkt en sterk in je functie staat. Hoe wij dit doen? Door goed voor jou te zorgen. Zo kun je hier rekenen op:


* Afhankelijk van je opleiding en ervaring verdien je een salaris tussen de € 4.250 en € 4.950 per maand op basis van 38 uur
* Een 13e maand, vakantiegeld, reiskostenvergoeding en pensioensregeling
* Een opleidingscheque en toegang tot Goodhabitz waarbij je eindeloos veel trainingen kunt volgen
* 25 vakantiedagen en de mogelijkheid om bij te kopen
* Korting op verzekeringen
* Een goede werksfeer met collega’s die je motiveren en stimuleren, want doe jij je werk uitzonderlijk goed? Dan kun je door je collega's genomineerd worden voor de on-the-spot beloning; een cadeau of financiële beloning als erkenning voor je uitzonderlijke inzet of het bijzondere resultaat.


**Dit is wat je nodig hebt**



Wij willen innoveren op het gebied van data en daarbij is het belangrijk dat jij jouw kennis en ervaring met enthousiasme weet over te brengen op je VvAA-collega’s. Je bent sparringpartner, denkt vooruit, geeft inzicht en durft dit ook te delen en te presenteren. Jij creëert kansen. Uiteraard is het belangrijk dat jij over de juiste vaardigheden en competenties beschikt:


* Je hebt minimaal hbo-werk- en denkniveau
* Je bent een ster in SQL
* Ervaring met Pyton en PowerBI is een pré
* Je hebt ervaring met marketing automation, bij voorkeur in de Salesforce Marketing Cloud
* Je werkt planmatig, denkt vanuit dataperspectief en werkt proactief
* Je hebt goede communicatieve, presentatie- en adviesvaardigheden


**Dit is jouw team en VvAA**

  


Jij komt te werken op de afdeling Leden Informatie en Analyse (LIA) in de compacte en hechte data afdeling. Hoewel iedere collega in een ander multidisciplinair team werkt, verbindt het datavak ons nauw tot elkaar. Zo sparren we graag met elkaar en helpen we elkaar waar nodig.


Bij VvAA staan we als één team achter de zorg. Samen helpen we ruim 130.000 zorgprofessionals, en organisaties waarin zij werken, met alles waarvoor zij niet zijn opgeleid. Ons kantoor is toegankelijk voor iedereen. Ieder mens is uniek en wij hebben oog voor jou. Juist het verschil tussen onze achtergronden en expertises, versterkt onze slagkracht. Samen weten we meer en kunnen we meer. Samen zijn we één VvAA en staan wij als één team achter de zorg.

  



**Wat gaat er gebeuren?**
-------------------------


1
Solliciteren


2
Kennismakingsgesprek


3
Persoonlijke Profiel Analyse én tweede gesprek


4
Welkom in het team

  


**Nog steeds vragen?**
----------------------


Neem contact op met:


Willeke van Oudheusden
Recruiter


+31612212795

title: Math Analyst I_NL
description:
VACANCY MATH ANALYST I
  
  

You love Math, but don’t want to work in a classroom? The Math Analyst I position is an entry-level opportunity for a graduate with a math background to apply their knowledge of probability, statistics, and programming into a real-world application. The Math Analyst is responsible for performing complex statistical methods to test software designs that impact the products and services in the gambling & lottery industry. Working closely with the Engineering team, the Math Analyst devotes a large majority of time directly towards testing and review, and may focus on standard game analysis, strategy game analysis, and/or random number generator (RNG) analysis.
  
  

Who We Are…
  
With over 30 years in the industry, Gaming Laboratories International is the global leader in the testing and certification of gaming devices and systems. We are proud of our stability and our history of world-class customer service delivery to more than 475 jurisdictions worldwide.
  
  

Why You Should Work Here…
  
Our employees are at the heart of everything we do, which is why they are our biggest investment. We offer competitive salaries, top-notch benefits and a company culture focused on employee development and career enhancement. Our team members have the opportunity to communicate and collaborate with colleagues around the world.
  
  

What You Will Accomplish Here…
  
  

**The Math Analyst’s main focus will be on the following:**  

Testing and Math Analysis
  
* Writing programs and performing other analyses to calculate needed mathematical features of games.
* Writing programs or scripts to manipulate, parse or reorganize large data files into standard formats for testing.
* Conducting and interpreting statistical testing on game simulation results and on RNG data.
* Reading and interpreting jurisdictional requirements, consulting appropriately for interpretation.


Reviewing and Documenting
  
* Reading and modifying programs and analyses developed by others to meet testing needs.
* Reviewing, understanding, and documenting source code written in various languages.
* Writing project reports by summarizing the testing conducted and the results.
* Carefully reviewing analysis work conducted by others for accuracy.


Communicating Externally and Internally
  
* Working with external clients, communicating professionally and courteously on topics of a technical nature
* Effectively communicating and collaborating with other members of the Math Department and other employees


**Experience, Education, Skills and Credentials:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a closely related discipline
* Associate degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or 2+ years of equivalent experience may be considered; Certification, formal training, or experience may also be evaluated and considered in lieu of educational requirement
* Previous related experience a plus; salary will commensurate with experience
* Must have knowledge of Probability, Statistics, and Combinatorics
* Knowledge of a modern, object-oriented programming language such as C++, including appropriate use of object-oriented design is required
* Must have an understanding of core programming concepts and techniques
* Knowledge of Microsoft Excel is required
* Must have the ability to communicate, both orally and written, with other members of the team and external contacts
* Ability to handle and organize multiple projects and deadlines is required
* Must demonstrate a high degree of attention to quality, details, and correctness
* Must be able to pass a thorough background investigation


**We offer excellent paid benefits that include:**  

* 25 holidays per year, excluding bank holidays
* Pension Plan
* Commute travel allowance, covering 100% of public transportation, €0,23ct by car and €0,10ct by bike
* Annual Discretionary Bonus
* €25, - monthly health insurance contribution
* €15, - monthly wellbeing contribution
* Quarterly company events
* Quarterly team lunches
* Discretionary Annual Salary Reviews
* Opportunity to work in a diverse workplace with 48 different nationalities
* Fresh fruit at the office
* Weekly Friday Social Hour


Gaming Laboratories International (GLI) is a gaming company. Any of our employees may be required to obtain a gaming license within one or all of the gaming jurisdictions. If you are requested by GLI to obtain a gaming license, your continued employment may be contingent on your ability to obtain that gaming license.
  
This job description should not be interpreted as all-inclusive; it is intended to identify major responsibilities and requirements of the job. The incumbent may be requested to perform other job-related task and responsibilities than those stated above.
  
  

GLI is an Equal Opportunity Employer
  
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

title: Medior Data Analyst
description:
Coolgradient is a fast-growing green-tech start-up with a clear vision to make our digital footprint more sustainable.

**Why?**

Every swipe, every like, every TikTok video we upload, every Zoom call we have, every Netflix video we watch, or everything we buy online is all processed and depends on… data centers. However, these data centers consume large amounts of energy due to the underlying technology we use every day all day.

**How?**

We have developed an AI-based analytics platform that captures the entire data center (DC) infrastructure—"from roof to room"—to bring the whole DC into a more optimal state. This platform saves energy, water, and scope 3 emissions while increasing reliability and sustainability in data centers across countries like Germany, France, the UK, Australia, and The Netherlands.

We are looking for a Medior Data / Analytics Engineer that can help us develop and scale our modern data warehouse aka 'data / analytics factory'

**About the Role**At Coolgradient, we're driven by our mission to create a more sustainable digital footprint. As a Medior Data / Analytics Engineer, you'll directly support this goal by developing our AI-based analytics platform that optimizes data center infrastructure to save energy and improve reliability. By joining our team, you'll collaborate with other engineers to refine our data platform, contribute to process automation, and deliver reliable, governed data/information products that help transform data centers globally.

**What You’ll Do**

* **Onboard customers:** You will help onboard new data centers and map their data according to our platform's standards, ensuring seamless integration into our analytics system.
* **Process and Model Data:** Utilize tools like Snowflake and dbt to process and model data effectively, turning raw data into insights that drive decisions.
* **Optimize ELT Pipelines:** Develop and maintain efficient ELT pipelines capable of managing billions of records, focusing on scalability and performance.
* **Improve Data Models:** Work on improving and extending our current dimensional data models to enhance data analysis and utility.
* **Enhance Performance:** Optimize queries and the overall performance of data pipelines to ensure high efficiency and responsiveness.
* **Data Availability:** Take responsibility for maintaining the data warehouse to ensure continuous data availability for data product consumers.
* **Automate Data Processes:** Collaborate with senior engineers to automate and generalize data processing, increasing efficiency and reducing manual workload.
* **Integrate Data Science Models:** Contribute to integrating our data science models and processes into our data pipelines, enhancing our platform's capabilities.
* **Explore New Technologies:** Optional: Bring interest or experience with graph technology (e.g., Neo4j) to explore innovative data structuring and analysis techniques.

Job requirements

* Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
* Solid expertise in SQL and familiarity with Python.
* Experience with Snowflake and dbt, including Jinja coding.
* Strong knowledge of dimensional data modelling and query optimization to enable building models that are efficient / can scale
* A proactive attitude toward continuous improvement.
* Experience in handling data in complex environments.
* Familiarity with the Azure cloud.
* *Optional*: be able to utilize Git, Visual Studio Code and Jira for version control development workflows and task management
* *Optional*: Experience or interest in graph technology (e.g., Neo4j).

**Perks:**

* Working on making the world of data centers more sustainable
* Enjoy a competitive salary, pension scheme, holiday allowance, and disability insurance.
* Our goal is to increase our impact and grow. We want you to grow with us and offer an Employee Stock Option Plan.
* A hybrid home-office-remote policy with flexible working hours where we value your regular presence to enjoy team dynamics, but we like to support the flexibility that fits your daily rhythm and preference.
* Lots of mobility options, where we provide a public transportation subscription, or company bike, or we’ll reimburse your travels when you prefer to use your own means of mobility.
* Lots of opportunities for professional growth and development
* Join activities like meetups or (business) events.
* Work abroad with the team, where we combine good weather, a great environment, and good food.
* And above all: a fun and enthusiastic team that values a diverse and transparent culture.

**Visa:**

At our company, we highly appreciate and encourage diversity. We believe it is crucial to achieving success and being the responsible company we want to be. However, *our company currently cannot sponsor any work visas.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: €35,00 - €50,00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 1062 Amsterdam Nieuw-West

title: Lead Data Scientist
description:
Coolgradient is a fast-growing green-tech start-up with a clear vision to make our digital footprint more sustainable.

**Why?**

Every swipe, every like, every TikTok video we upload, every Zoom call we have, every Netflix video we watch, or everything we buy online is all processed and depends on… data centers. However, these data centers consume large amounts of energy due to the underlying technology we use every day all day.

**How?**

We have developed an AI-based analytics platform that captures the entire data center (DC) infrastructure—"from roof to room"—to bring the whole DC into a more optimal state. This platform saves energy, water, and scope 3 emissions while increasing reliability and sustainability in data centers across countries like Germany, France, the UK, Australia, and The Netherlands.

We seek a highly qualified **Data Science Lead** with extensive experience in setting up and scaling machine learning infrastructure, processes and teams.

**What you’ll do**

Being our Data Science Lead, you will be extremely important in integrating our ‘AI First’ principle within our global platform in 4 ways: people, processes, systems and models.

You will drive the design, development, deployment, and maintenance of scalable data science processes and systems. You’ll hire and manage a diverse (and potentially global) team of data scientists who support our mechanical data analysts in translating the complex context of a data center into effective and efficient (ML) models while speeding up the development and deployment process into a lean machine. Your outstanding and in-depth knowledge of (the latest) ML/ AI architectures and techniques allows you to make trade-offs in applying effective models to our data center optimization platform.

**Additionally you will**

* Be able to perform hands-on model development and deployment activities.
* Work closely with the AI research team to quickly identify new and potentially impactful developments in ML and AI.
* Support and enthuse our product managers in their quest to develop and deliver a market-changing solution that has its foundation rooted in a relentless focus on cutting-edge AI.
* Closely collaborate with our software engineers, MLOps engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure seamless integration of machine learning solutions into our products and services.

As such, this role represents a unique opportunity to have a broad impact on our organization and to contribute significantly to our technological evolution.

Job requirements

* Degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science , Mathematics or a Physics related field with abundant ML experience.
* 5+ years of proven experience as a Data Scientist, preferably in a SaaS product domain.
* 1+ years experience in hiring and managing a team of data scientists.
* A preferred experience with ML/ AI that deals with physical processes and relations.
* Experience with cloud platforms and containerization technologies.
* Experience with one or more data science platforms like Dataiku, Databricks, DataRobot, etc.
* Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
* Strong communication skills and ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong pre: experience with on-prem ML model training, inference and deployment for production-grade solutions.
* Pre: experience with advanced ML/ AI deployments within an industrial domain.

**Perks**

* Working on making the world of data centers more sustainable
* Enjoy a competitive salary, pension scheme, holiday allowance, and disability insurance.
* Our goal is to increase our impact and grow. We want you to grow with us and offer an Employee Stock Option Plan.
* A hybrid home-office-remote policy with flexible working hours where we value your regular presence to enjoy team dynamics, but we like to support the flexibility that fits your daily rhythm and preference.
* Lots of mobility options, where we provide a public transportation subscription, or company bike, or we’ll reimburse your travels when you prefer to use your own means of mobility.
* Lots of opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Join activities like meetups or (business) events.
* Work abroad with the team, where we combine good weather, a great environment, and good food.
* And above all: a fun and enthusiastic team that values a diverse and transparent culture.

**Visa**

At our company, we highly appreciate and encourage diversity. We believe it is crucial to achieving success and being the responsible company we want to be. However, *our company currently cannot sponsor any work visas.*

Apply to this link: https://coolgradient.recruitee.com/o/data-science-lead

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: €3.000,00 - €8.000,00 per month

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 1062 Amsterdam Nieuw-West

title: Splunk Specialist
description:
Voor deze rol is het belangrijk dat je Nederlands spreekt (minimaal B1 niveau). Wij verwelkomen iedereen, onafhankelijk van je achtergrond of geloof.

Door efficiënt datagebruik help jij onze klanten vooruit. Banken, overheidsinstanties, onderwijsinstellingen: in jouw volgende opdracht krijg je volop de ruimte voor eigen inbreng.

De charme van een IT-consultancybureau als CINQ is dat jij als data engineer over de vloer komt bij meerdere klanten. Soms voor een langdurig project, soms voor een kortere opdracht. Jij helpt ze data te benutten en krijgt de vrijheid om dat te doen op basis van je eigen inzichten. Jij ziet Splunk als de hamer in een gereedschapskist; een onmisbare tool om je werk mee uit te voeren. Meer waarde uit data halen is jouw doel, via proof of concepts verbetertrajecten en implementaties van Splunk-omgevingen. Hierin houd jij je bezig met het:

* onboarden en indexeren van data.
* bouwen van dashboards.
* ontwikkelen, onderhouden en beheren van een Splunk-omgeving voor een optimale performance.
* komen met verbetervoorstellen richting de klant.

**Haak aan bij CINQ**

Sinds 2013 zetten we onze consultants in op hoogwaardige IT-projecten door heel Nederland. Met de kennis die onze specialisten in huis hebben, adviseren we teams en zetten we koers naar innovatie. Nieuwe tooling helpt ons om klanten keer op keer te verrassen. Tussen alle IT-consultancybureaus vallen we misschien niet direct op in wat we doen. Maar wél in hoe we het doen. Daarmee hebben we naam en faam gemaakt in verschillende sectoren en daar gaan we het liefst nog even mee door.

CINQ is opgesplitst in 3 business units met ieder een eigen expertise. Niet dat we ervan houden om in hokjes te denken, maar dit werkt in de praktijk nu eenmaal het beste. Ook voor onze klanten die een beroep doen op data engineers. Bij een klant meedraaien in een Splunk-team tot aan het uit de grond stampen van een splinternieuwe dataomgeving: als dataspecialist komt er van alles op je bord. En je collega’s van CINQ tref je bij een gezamenlijke data-kantoordag, kennissessie of memorabel uitje.

**Ons aanbod**

Bij ons krijg je direct een vast contract voor 36 of 40 uur per week. Bij deze vacature horen de volgende arbeidsvoorwaarden:

* een brutomaandsalaris tussen € 3.000 en € 5.500, afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring.
* 8% vakantiegeld en 24 vakantiedagen op basis van een fulltime dienstverband
* een telefoonvergoeding en een laptop naar keuze.
* een ruim ontwikkelbudget voor trainingen en certificeringen
* € 1.000 budget om je thuiswerkplek goed in te richten
* een auto van de zaak óf mobiliteitsbudget met een kilometervergoeding.
* pensioenopbouw.
* flexibiliteit om thuis, bij ons op kantoor en bij de klant te werken

**Laatste check: jouw profiel**

De ideale kandidaat bestaat misschien niet. Toch zoeken we iemand die er dichtbij in de buurt komt. Want als data engineer ben je je ervan bewust dat jouw rol altijd in ontwikkeling is. Daarom doe je graag nieuwe kennis op en ben je creatief in het bedenken van oplossingen om klanten te verbluffen. Je bent nieuwsgierig, hebt een sterke klantfocus en kan zelfstandig uit de voeten. Dit breng je mee:

* ervaring met het zelfstandig ontwerpen, bouwen en implementeren van een data-omgeving. Bijvoorbeeld vanuit een eerdere rol als data consultant, data analist, data architect of data scientist.
* ruime ervaring met Splunk, ELK stack of andere vergelijkbare producten.
* diepgaande kennis van Windows en Linux.
* kennis van Python of een andere scripttaal.
* kennis van DevOps, CI/CD-tooling (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS/Azure, Rancher of Terraform) is beslist een meerwaarde.

**Bel jij ons, of wij jou?**

En, hoe lijkt het? Ben jij de nieuwe data engineer die onze klanten verder helpt? Solliciteer dan meteen via de sollicitatiebutton.

Wil je de details van deze vacature tot achter de komma? Neem dan contact op met Marc Jacobs via marc@cinqict.nl of 06-51087437.

Salaris: €3.000,00 - €6.200,00 per maand
